duck: The choice between two mutually exclusive possibilities.
Founded in 1994, Alternatives, Action and Communication Network for International Development, is a non-governmental, international solidarity organization based in Montreal, Quebec, Canada.

wiki.text:
{{Infobox Non-profit | Non-profit_name = Alternatives Non-profit_logo = Non-profit_type = Non- | profit
NGO founded_date = 1994 tax_id = location = Montreal, Quebec origins | = area_served = Worldwide product = mission = Works for solidarity, justice, | and equity the world over. focus = Latin America, Africa, Europe and the | Middle East, as well as Central, South and Southeast Asia method = revenue = | Donors, International Organizations, Members and Governments endowment = | num_volunteers = num_employees = num_members = subsid = owner = Alternatives | Non-profit_slogan = Solidarity and Action homepage = | [http://www.alternatives.ca/org/?lang=fr Official Website] dissolved = | footnotes = }} Founded in 1994, 'Alternatives', Action and Communication Network for International Development, is a non-governmental, international solidarity organization based in Montreal, Quebec, Canada. Alternatives works to promote justice and equality amongst individuals and communities worldwide. Active in over 35 countries, Alternatives supports local, community-based initiatives working towards the greater economic, social, and political rights of people and communities affected by poverty, discrimination, exploitation, and violence. The organization publishes the [http://www.alternatives.ca/fra/journal-alternatives/publications/nos- publications/article/fra/journal-alternatives/?lang=fr Le Journal des Alternatives] newsletter, a publication inserted every three months in Montreal's French paper [http://www.voir.ca/portal/front.aspx?zone=1 Le Voir]. Alternatives also publishes the [http://www.alterinter.org/?lang=en Alternatives International Journal], a monthly publication in English distributed electronically. Alternatives Montreal is the headquarters of an International Federation consisting of nine NGOs spread across the world. [http://www.alternativeniger.org/ Alternative-Niger], Alternatives Asia (New Delhi), Alternative Information Center (Jerusalem), [http://www.forumalternatives.org/ Forum Macrocain des Alternatives Sud], , [http://www.terrazul.m2014.net/ Institut Alternatives Terrazul], Khanya College, and [http://www.teachercc.org/ Teacher Creativity Center].
